newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Gaza students demand passage to West Bank.
newsitem.headline: Gaza students demand passage to West Bank.

text.p: Palestinian students from the Gaza Strip called on Israel on Saturday to permit them passage across the Jewish state to their West Bank universities.

A statement issued by the West Bank's Bir Zeit University said Israel was preventing 1,300 Gaza students from travelling through Israel to the West Bank under restrictions tightened since a series of Palestinian bombs in Israeli cities a year ago.
Spokesman Shlomo Dror, from the office of Israel's coordinator of policy in the occupied territories, said the students pose a "security risk."
He said violent confrontations between Israelis and Palestinians last September that left 76 people dead started with student protests at Bir Zeit.
"Many students participated in terrorism and violence and we have reached the conclusion for security reasons the Gaza students should stay in Gaza," Dror said.
He added anti-Israeli material had been found at universities.

The Palestinian human rights group al-Haq said in a separate statement the Israeli restrictions violated international law as well as Palestinian-Israeli peace agreements. It called for an international campaign against the Israeli policy.
Dror said Israel was examining the restrictions and "thinking how to ease the conditions."
